name: Eternal Tale: Seal of the Four Heroes (Demo)
name_original: Eternal Tale: Seal of the Four Heroes (Demo)
description:
One thousand years ago, the evil Queen Zola attained immortality and conquered the world. Four brave heroes rose to the task of defeating her, but were unable to deal a decisive blow to the immortal queen. With the last of their strength, the heroes sealed Queen Zola away with magic, ending her evil reign. But now, those who worship the evil queen have begun to move, and if nothing is done, the evil queen may rise again...

It's up to you to save this world! Find strong allies, and equip yourself with powerful weapons and magic, so that you may battle against the fiends that seek to revive Queen Zola! And if you fail in your quest... this world will certainly be devoured by darkness...

Eternal Tale: Seal of the Four Heroes is an 8-bit, retro-inspired game designed with RPG Maker MZ. If you are looking for a nostalgic trip back to the good ol' days of the 1980s, look no further than this exciting tale! Currently, you are able to play through the entire first chapter of the game in this demo, which will take approximately 2-3 hours, though the full game is expected to have 5 chapters in total.

Included with this download are a few extra documents - a full game manual (EternalTaleInstructionBooklet.pdf) that should answer all of your questions about the game's mechanics, as well as a strategy guide (EternalTaleStrategyGuide.pdf) that provides a full walkthrough of the demo's contents. There is also a mock magazine ad (EternalTaleMagazineAd01.png) included as well!

To play the game, remove the game cartridge from it's case and insert it into your Mintenmo Amusement Console, then press the power button unzip the folder and open game.exe!

I would appreciate any comments and reviews for the game! After all, your comments can only help me make the game better! If you discover any bugs, typos, or generally bad design choices, please let me know! 

A full list of the game's credits, including all who contributed graphics, plugins and so forth can be found at the end of the game manual included with the download.
